Detailed Description

Represents a trajectory x(t), y(t), h(t), with a smooth velocity and piecewise-continuous acceleration.

Note that this provides two interfaces: one accepting RJ::Seconds, which is a duration, and one accepting RJ::Time, an instant in time.

This uses cubic interpolation between two adjacent instants, fitting a parametric cubic polynomial based on initial and final posiiton and velocity.

A trajectory also carries a timestamp representing the time at which it was planned. This should be filled in using trajectory.stamp(RJ::Time) before publishing, and will be reset to nullopt when the trajectory is modified.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

◆ Trajectory() [1/2]

planning::Trajectory::Trajectory ( Trajectory  a,
const Trajectory &  b 
)

Create a trajectory from two other trajectories. Assumes a.last() == b.first() so b.first() is skipped.

Is able to move out of the first trajectory, but not the second.

◆ Trajectory() [2/2]

std::optional< RobotInstant > planning::Trajectory::evaluate ( RJ::Seconds  seconds) const

Evaluate this trajectory (calculate position and velocity) at a given duration past the beginning of the trajectory.

Note
When iterating over a trajectory, prefer the cursor interface.
Parameters
secondsThe duration since the beginning of the path.
Returns
The RobotInstant at that duration into the path, or nullopt if seconds is out-of-bounds.

Note
When iterating over a trajectory, prefer the cursor interface.
Parameters
timeThe time point to evaluate at (absolute time, not a duration into the path)

◆ hold_for()

void planning::Trajectory::hold_for ( RJ::Seconds  duration)

Hold the final position for a set time.

Note that this will not hold forever. That would be bad, because iterating over a trajectory would always hang.

Parameters
secondsthe duration after the end of the trajectory to hold pose.

◆ mark_angles_valid()

void planning::Trajectory::mark_angles_valid ( )
inline

Mark this trajectory as having a valid angle profile.

This will be reset upon the following conditions:

  • New instants are appended
  • The trajectory is concatenated with another trajectory.

void planning::Trajectory::scale_duration ( RJ::Seconds  final_duration,
RJ::Time  fixed_point 
)

Contract or expand this trajectory by scaling velocities and timestamps (relative to the beginning).

Parameters
final_durationThe final duration of the trajectory.
fixed_pointThe time point that should remain unchanged. Defaults to the beginning of the trajectory.

◆ sub_trajectory()

Trajectory planning::Trajectory::sub_trajectory ( RJ::Time  clip_start_time,
RJ::Time  clip_end_time 
) const

Returns a trajectory formed using an interval subset of this trajectory.

Parameters
clip_start_timeThe time from which the sub-trajectory should start.
clip_end_timeThe time at which the sub-trajectory should end. If it is after the trajectory's end, the sub-trajectory will be taken to the end of the trajectory.
Returns
a sub-trajectory of the original trajectory.
